intro: Orixa ternata, commonly known as the three-lobed orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
